column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=South Sudan gains independence
#Text=Sunday , July 10 , 2011
#Text=At 0000 EAT Saturday ( 2100 UTC Friday ) , the Republic of South Sudan achieved independent recognition , becoming the newest country on the planet .
#Text=The parliament speaker for the new country recited a formal independence declaration .

#Text=After independence was declared , the South Sudanese flag was lifted for all to see , with Sudan People 's Liberation Army/Movement secretary general Pagan Amum stating : " Today we shall raise the flag of South Sudan to join the nations of the world " .
#Text=Today we shall raise the flag of South Sudan to join the nations of the world — Pagan Amum , Sudan People 's Liberation Army/Movement secretary general
#Text=Thousands of jubilant people celebrated in the new country 's capital Juba .
#Text=They danced in the streets , sang songs and waved flags .
#Text=Churches rang their bells at midnight as independence arrived .

#Text=People crowded to the official ceremonial site , held at the mausoleum of John Garang , leader of the rebellion who died several months after the peace deal was signed with Sudan , ending the bloody conflict .
#Text=Many of the celebrants spoke emotionally of their family members who died in the long struggle with Sudan .
#Text=George Garang , an English teacher , said he lost his father , grandfather and eleven brothers .
#Text=" My whole body feels happy , " he said .

#Text=Valentino Achak Deng , who was a refugee during the war , said : " Really in my heart what makes me happiest is that from today , when people ask me where I am from , I do not have to say Sudan . "
#Text=Salva Kiir Mayardit has assumed the role as president of South Sudan .
#Text=Kiir swore to pledge true alliance and faithfulness to South Sudan .
#Text=In a speech , Kiir declared amnesty for any who have taken up arms against Sudan .
#Text=Kiir insisted that martyrs for the cause of the new country did not die in vain , although South Sudan waited 56 years to be free .
#Text=The southern Sudanese had agitated for more rights , even before Sudan became free from its British colonizers in 1956 .

#Text=Sudan was divided into three separate demographic groups , with the southern part of the country home to Christians and animists and the northern part dominated by Arab populations and those of Muslim faith .
#Text=Kiir said to people of Abyei , Darfur , Blue Nile and South Kordofan , who remain part of Sudan , that " we have not forgotten you .
